poem:
### Stream of Change

Notes float —  
unfurling tangled tunes  

white petals —  
but silence seeps where  
once sound stood.  

a world where  
echoes from cornered  
rooms rest.  

indie voices risen,  
unyielding, seek truth  
amid tilted tones.  

the hum of rebellion,  
a whispered song  
swelling in the dusk.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I can see a world where Spotify doesn’t exist’: will a new generation of music streaming companies succeed? The noise around Spotify this year has been louder than ever, from Liz Pelly’s book Mood Machine – a biting indictment of the company and its alleged practices – to a slew of indie artists leaving the platform due to political and ethical reasons. There was even a recent music forum in California called Death to Spotify.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘I can see a world where Spotify doesn’t exist’: will a new generation of music streaming companies succeed? The noise around Spotify this year has been louder than ever, from Liz Pelly’s book Mood Machine – a biting indictment of the company and its alleged practices – to a slew of indie artists leaving the platform due to political and ethical reasons. There was even a recent music forum in California called Death to Spotify.
